questions.question: What is the main objective of the POSH Act?
options: To promote gender equality in the workplace.
To ensure that all workers are provided with equal pay.
To prevent and address sexual harassment in the workplace.
To create awareness about sexual harassment.

questions.question: Under the POSH Act, sexual harassment includes:
options: Physical contact and advances only.
Verbal or non-verbal conduct of a sexual nature.
Only incidents involving employees of the same gender.
Only incidents that occur during work hours.

questions.question: Who is responsible for preventing sexual harassment in the workplace?
options: Only the HR department.
Only the victim of harassment.
Employers, employees, and other stakeholders.
Government agencies alone.

questions.question: The POSH Act mandates the formation of which of the following?
options: Gender-specific advisory committees.
Internal Complaints Committee (ICC).
Workplace wellness committees.
Employee unions.

questions.question: Who can file a complaint under the POSH Act?
options: Only female employees.
Only employees above the age of 25.
Any employee who feels they have been sexually harassed.
Only senior employees.

questions.question: How long does an employee have to file a complaint after an incident of sexual harassment?
options: 6 months
3 months
1 year
1 month

questions.question: What should be done if an employee is found guilty of sexual harassment under the POSH Act?
options: The employee may be terminated from employment.
The employee will face a monetary fine only.
The employee will be given a warning.
The case will be disregarded if there is no physical evidence.

questions.question: The POSH Act applies to:
options: Only formal offices in urban areas.
All workplaces, including non-organized sectors.
Only government institutions.
Only workplaces with more than 100 employees.

questions.question: What is the role of the Internal Complaints Committee (ICC)?
options: To train employees on gender sensitivity.
To act as a mediator in all workplace conflicts.
To investigate complaints of sexual harassment and recommend actions.
To supervise employee salaries.

questions.question: Which of the following is a measure to prevent sexual harassment in the workplace?
options: Ignoring complaints from employees.
Ensuring that all employees undergo regular sexual harassment training.
Allowing inappropriate behavior to continue unchecked.
Avoiding discussions about the issue to prevent discomfort.
